I'm running java 1.3, so I know I need the SSL package, b/c it is not in incorporated in the Java bundle until ver. 1.4.  The specific error I'm getting is this:
 [junit] java.lang.RuntimeException: java.net.SocketException: SSL implementation not available    [junit]     at javax.net.ssl.DefaultSSLSocketFactory.createSocket(DashoA6275)    [junit]     at I have the SSL jar I need in an included directory.  If i take it out of there it throws a different error:
[junit] java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: https support requires the Java Secure Sockets Extension. See http://java.sun.com/products/jsse
So I know it's finding it, but why doesn't it work now?For reference, I'm trying to do some unit testing using JWebUnit on top of JUnit and automating it using ant.Thank you.
